description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows CoreMessaging information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2024-20694), it is essential to ensure that all affected systems are updated with the relevant security patches. This CVE has been prioritized due to its significant impact on confidentiality.

1. Identify the version of Windows in use and note the corresponding build number.
2. Download and install the following security updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog according to your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122)
   - For Windows Server 2022: [KB5034129](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034129)
   - For Windows Server 2019: [KB5034127](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034127)
3. Restart the system post-update to apply changes.

**Details**:
This update addresses the information disclosure risk by ensuring that only authorized users can access sensitive information, thereby safeguarding the integrity of system resources and improving overall security posture. Verify that your system aligns with the stated update specifications before proceeding.

**Preconditions**:
- Always back up system data before applying updates to avoid any accidental loss.
- Ensure you have administrative rights to perform installations.
